intro: Leucopogon recurvatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths, heathers, and blueberries. The plant typically grows in sandy or acidic soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Leucopogon recurvatus is generally hardy and adaptable, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystems.
